alert.note: Alert for Spencer; Vanderburgh; Warrick (Indiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Paducah (Southern Illinois and Indiana, Southeastern Missouri and Western Kentucky)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 11 at 10:02AM EST until January 15 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Paducah
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following river in Kentucky...Illinois...Indiana... Ohio River at Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown, and Golconda. .Heavy rainfall and recent snow melt led to the current flooding on the Ohio River. Water levels are forecast to drop below flood stage at points along the river through the weekend. For the Ohio River...including Newburgh Dam, Mount Vernon, J.T. Myers Dam, Shawneetown, and Golconda...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM THIS MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Ohio River at Newburgh Dam. * WHEN...Until Saturday evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:00 AM CST Tuesday the stage was 38.4 feet. - Forecast...The river will fall below flood stage late this afternoon, dropping to 37.5 feet tomorrow afternoon It will then rise above flood stage late Thursday night, cresting at 38.4 feet late Friday afternoon. It will fall below flood stage again early Saturday afternoon. - Flood stage is 38.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov.
